chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take/Drive Veh. w/o Consent-Abandon Veh., a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3m).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must obtain summer employment to pay restitution.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.

No entry into any bar/taverns.

Court not bound to early release of probation but noted in court that the state does not object and leaves decision up to probation. 

Defendant may petition the court for expunction upon completion of all conditions of probation.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.
Defendant must write letter of apolocgy to victim within 30 days of probation.

Defendant Michael L Taylor in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:07 a.m. Burns has handed court a plea questionaire. Burns thought the state was going to file an amended complaint. Bednar unaware, adjourn to talk with Simono. Off record (9:08 a.m.) Back on the record (9:16 a.m.), same appearances. State has now filed Amended Information, Burns has received a copy and has explained elements to defendant and waives further reading and enters G pleas to both counts. State - withhold sentence, place on probation for 1 year, restitution of $1000, AODA and follow through, absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol, no entry into bars/taverns, must obtain employment to pay restituition, no objection to expungement. Burns agrees with recommendation asks if defendant may also petition to end probation early once restitution is paid. Court not bound to early release of probation but is noted that the state does not object, leaves up to probation. Defendant pleads G to both counts. Court goes over plea questionaire with defendant. Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntairily and intellegently waived his right to jury trial by entering his plea. Court accepts plea and adjudges him guilty. State has complied with victim notification. Burns makes final argument. Taylor makes statement, remorseful. Letter of character admitted to the court. Court accepts the joint recommendation and sentences the following: Count 1 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: $1000 in restituition, AODA and follow through, no consumption or possession alcohol, no entry into bars or taverns, must obtain summer job to pay restitution, letter of apology to victim within 30 days of probation, may petition to the court for expungement. Count 2 - with hold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with same conditions as count 1 and to run concurrent. Post conviction relief rights given.
From attorney asking to set for PLEAS - approved by judge.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-27-2015 09:00 am

#1 - series of pictures of damaged car; #2 - series of pictures of damaged car; #3 - estimate from Shimkus Auto Body; #4 - estimate from Rhinelander Collision Center; #5 - affidavit of John Johnson Jr.
Jury trial at 03-27-2015 08:30 am

Attorney Mary L.R. Burns in court. Defendant Michael Taylor appears telephonically with leave of the Court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:40 PM. Victim also in courtroom. Here for restitution hearing. Court has questions of victim regarding restitution request. Burns responds, states unjust enrichment for stated reasons, will conceit to $200 restitution. Victim not willing to settle for $200.00. Victim has subpoenaed a witness, Brian Shimkus. Shimkus sworn in at 3:45 PM. Direct exam by State/victim. State offers exhibit #3 - estimate for car damages. Court receives exhibit #3 after no objections (3:51 PM). State offers exhibit #1 - picture of damage to vehicle. Direct exam by Burns at 3:55 PM. State objects - argumentative - overruled (3:57 PM). Court asks questions of witness at 3:59 PM. Shimkus excused at 3:59 PM. C.K. sworn in at 4:00 PM. Direct exam/testimony assisted by State. Court receives exhibit #1 after no objections (4:06 PM). State offers exhibit #2 - photos of damaged vehicle. Court receives exhibit #2 after no objections (4:07 PM). State offers exhibit #4 - second estimate for car damages. Court receives exhibit #4 after no objections (4:11 PM). Burns objects - argument - overruled (4:13 PM). Cross exam by Burns at 4:15 PM. CK excused at 4:20 PM. Burns calls Johnathon Johnson Jr. Johnson sworn in at 4:22 PM. Direct exam by Burns. Cross exam by CK at 4:32 PM. State asks question of witness at 4:36 PM. Johnson excused at 4:41 PM. Court receives exhibit #5 after no objections (4:41 PM). Michael Taylor sworn in at 4:42 PM. Direct exam by Burns. Court has questions of defendant. State has questions of defendant (4:45 PM). CK has questions of defendant. Burns makes final argument for unjustful enrichment. Court makes decision - will award restitution of $1000.00 if convicted/guilty, finds defendant has the ability to pay, continues bond, set for further proceedings.  Jury trial scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing at 02-25-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Michael L Taylor in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:06 am. Has complaint. Court advises of charges/penalties and right to attorney. Adjourn to talk to SPD.  Recalled 9:44 am. Michael Taylor now appears with attorney Mary Burns and state by Charles Simono. Burns waives reading. Asking court to waive PH Taylor agrees. Court goes thru waiver and finds that defendant is waiving his right to PH freely, voluntarily and intelligently, finds probable cause and binds over. State files INFO (mirrors) will proceed to ARGN. Pleads NG to only count. State $2500 sig bond no contact with Cindy Kotila.
